page.title: 05THE CHURCH OF ST MARY
page.content: Maldon has two famous churches.One is All Saints Church which stands at the top end of the High Street.It is unique because it has a triangular tower.There are only a few in England. At the other end of the High Street, overlooking the river,stands St Mary's church.It is built from pebbles set in cement.It has a hexagonal spire made of Essex weatherboard.The church was founded in 1056.It is used for daily services.Both churches play a big part in the lives of Maldon people. St Mary's Church tower and spire can be seen whilst sailing up the Black- water Estuary.It used to be known as Beacon Church and was used as a guide by sailors using the quay as far back as medieval times.
